clinical_study.brief_title: Interaction Between St John's Wort and Metformin?
clinical_study.official_title: Is There a Pharmacokinetic Interaction Between St John's Wort and Metformin?

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to examine the difference of the pharmacokinetics of metformin with and without a 3 weeks pretreatment of St John's Wort. Furthermore secondary objectives include changes in GLP-1, C-peptide, serum-insulin and plasma-glucose during an oral glucose tolerance test, changes in OCT1 mRNA in plasma and changes in leptin and lipid-profile following this possible interaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Area Under Curve (AUC) 0-24h of metformin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Concentration of metformin at 0, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 hours after metformin ingestion
primary_outcome.description: Change in 0-24h AUC of metformin after 3 weeks of treatment with St John's Wort

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 2 hours of each metformin ingestion
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in: Plasma-glucose, serum-insulin, glucagon-like peptide 1 (GLP-1) and connecting-peptides (C-peptides) during the oral glucose tolerance test, measured at 0, 0.5, 1, 1.5 and 2 hours after metformin ingestion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Concentration of metformin at 0, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 hours after metformin ingestion, which will be used to determine the pharmacokinetic parameters mentioned below
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of other pharmacokinetic parameters of metformin such as clearance (CL), absorption fraction (F), distribution volume (V), the minimum concentration at steady state (Css,min), elimination half life (T 1/2) etc.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Will be measured 4 times: At inclusion (t=0 on that day), at t=0 in both periods and minimum 3 weeks after finalization of the study (t=0 on that day)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in mRNA encoding OCT1 will be measured at 4 different time points to give an insight to the importance of St John's Wort effect on the OCT1 production

other_outcome.description: If possible measure the concentrations of some of the active components of St John's Wort, hypericin and hyperforin

arm_group.description: 7 days of pretreatment with metformin before full pharmacokinetics and other goals are investigated. Minimum 1 week of washout after this period. 3 weeks of pretreatment with St John's Wort and the last 7 days metformin is ingested again, and the same effect parameters as described above is performed again

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men aged 18-64 years
- Homozygous for common genetic variants in the genes organic cation transporter 1/2 (OCT1/OCT2)
- Normal values of biomarkers accounting for: Liver and kidney function, and normal blood glucose
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic alcohol abuse
- Hypersensitivity to metformin or St John's Wort
- Daily intake of drugs requiring prescription
